top_categories.workout_context: Nordic Chase Gravel Edition’s 373-mile distance demands power production deep into fatigue — the defining challenge of ultra-distance gravel.
Racing Nordic Chase Gravel Edition isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Nordic Chase Gravel Edition’s scandinavian gravel (70%), paved roads (30%) demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Nordic Chase Gravel Edition when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Nordic Chase Gravel Edition’s 26,247ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Nordic Chase Gravel Edition rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Nordic Chase Gravel Edition’s scandinavian countryside—rolling gravel + coastal sections and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
At 373 miles, Nordic Chase Gravel Edition rewards a massive aerobic engine. This volume work builds the fat-oxidation capacity that keeps you moving when glycogen runs low.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Nordic Chase Gravel Edition’s scandinavian countryside—rolling gravel + coastal sections delivers on race day.
Every session at Nordic Chase Gravel Edition intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Nordic Chase Gravel Edition. Make this intensity feel like home.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Nordic Chase Gravel Edition — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.

race_overlay.nutrition: Ultra-distance fueling for 373 miles: 80–100g carbs/hour from mile 1 — don’t wait until you’re hungry. Practice your exact race-day nutrition in every long training ride. Carry backup calories. 373 miles burns 8,000–12,000+ calories — you cannot replace them all, but you must try.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Nordic Chase Gravel Edition requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on scandinavian countryside—rolling gravel + coastal sections to build confidence. Expect: scandinavian gravel (70%), paved roads (30%), rolling countryside.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Race Simulation, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 373 miles of scandinavian countryside—rolling gravel + coastal sections in Copenhagen, Denmark to Oslo, Norway.
